title: Emercy 2019 Grenache-Cabernet Sauvignon-Petite Sirah Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fresh and yet very opulent aromas of black and red cherry meet with light caramel and chai spice on the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 42% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petite Sirah. Fresh and crisp berry flavors pop on the palate, aided by healthy doses of dried herb and dark spice.

title: Center of Effort 2020 Effort Rosé of Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Rose petals, light pluot and a hint of spearmint on the nose make for very crisp aromas in this Grenache-based rosé. There's tremendous texture to the palate, giving a grippy edge to the softer, fresh flavors of strawberry and watermelon.

title: Clementine Carter 2019 Larner Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: A light shade in the glass, this bottling pops on the nose with dried cherry, pomegranate and rose-petal aromas, with just the slightest hint of game lingering beneath. Bouncy fruit flavors of red punch zip across the acid-driven sip, where a grippy structure leads into a finish where dark-spice elements arise.

title: Fess Parker 2019 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean and approachable aromas of cherry and spice cake make for a familiar and delicious entry to the nose of this wine. The palate shows darker cherry flavors as well as plenty of clove and mace, surrounding a mouthfeel that is very full without being too rich.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2018 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Aromas of lemon peel, Gravenstein apple and struck stone light up the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tense and stony, but also generous in flavors of lemon cream and crisp yellow apple.

title: Crū 2019 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a vibrant and lively wine from an exciting vineyard. Aromas of raspberry sorbet, sage and white pepper lead the nose into a bright and zippy palate that's full of cranberry, plum and lingering cracked pepper flavors.

title: Crū 2020 French Camp Vineyard Jose's Rosé of Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: There's an earthy tone to the nose of this bottling, with lanolin aromas meeting the sweeter red-plum tones. The palate is tart with pluot-flesh and citrus-skin flavors.
designation: French Camp Vineyard Jose's Rosé of

title: Delta 2019 Chenin Blanc (California)
description: This serious, medium-bodied wine features golden apple and apricot flavors, a mouthfilling texture and a sense of ripeness and power.

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2020 White (Alentejano)
description: The wine is rich and fruity with white and yellow fruit flavors. It has spice and a ripe line of almonds to go with the crisp final acidity. Drink now.

title: Duckhorn 2018 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Softly layered in blueberry, leather and a hint of barnyardlike earth, this wine is high-toned and full-bodied, with generous ripeness.

title: Girard 2019 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Made in a rich, fruit-forward style, this white is soft and succulent in apple and grapefruit, lushly textured and plump on the palate.

title: Heath Vineyards 2018 Liberation Blocks 4B/5 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very ripe and extracted aromas of dark stewed fruits and grape seed show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with sweet and ripe flavors of juicy strawberry and cherry, with a light herbal spice adding complexity.

title: Marie Copinet NV Brut Caractère Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, red-fruit-flavored Champagne also offers touches of spice, good acidity and a tang of minerality at the end. Drink the wine now.

title: Oakdale Road 2019 Reserve Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: A bit shy on the nose, this bottling picks up some momentum on the palate, where leather, crushed rocks and dried blue-fruit flavors align. The finish is awash in vanilla candy.

title: Paraduxx 2018 Rector Creek Vineyard Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tart, tannic and thickly constructed blend of 60% Cabernet Franc with 40% Zinfandel. Densely concentrated and weighty, it shows broad strokes of baking spice, oak and cranberry.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2019 Domaine de la Rablais Red (Touraine Chenonceaux)
description: Malbec and Cabernet Franc come together in this ripe, black-fruit-flavored wine. Light tannins and full berry flavors partner in a juicy, structured combination. Drink the wine now.

title: Paris-Simoneau NV Brut Sparkling (Touraine)
description: This wine offers almond and ripe apple flavors. Bright acidity contrasts with the rich fruits and open mousse. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Peju 2020 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Medium bodied and high-toned, this straightforward white offers tart, pithy and floral layers of grapefruit, melon and honeysuckle.

title: Babcock 2019 The Limit Radian Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a unique streak of alkalinity and floral botanicals on the nose of this bottling. Lime flavors pop on the refreshing palate, where light mint and crushed stone elements add tension and complexity.

title: Folktale 2018 The Hound Red (Carmel Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Malbec, 11% Merlot, 9% Petit Verdot and 9% Cabernet Franc, which is primarily from the Massa Estate, shows boisterous aromas of boysenberry, crumpled flowers and acai on the nose. Massive tannins and strong acidity rise up on the sip, so give the dark fruits time to emerge from behind that veil. Drink 2023–2032.

title: Babcock 2019 Radical Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cherry-liqueur aromas are spiced by mace, clove and oak on the nose of this bottling. Layers of dark-fruit flavors and barrel spice converge on the palate, which shows more nutmeg, vanilla and clove.

title: Castoro Cellars 2020 Whale Rock Vineyard Estate Falanghina (Paso Robles)
description: This is an exciting show for this grape that's very rare in California. Ambrosial aromas of melon and orange blossom meet with crushed chalk on the nose, while the texturally grippy palate offers fresh flavors of Asian pear and Meyer lemon.

title: Crū 2017 Vineyard Montage Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Roasted pomegranate, wet rocks and earth aromas converge on the nose of this appellation blend. Tart red-plum-skin and fresh pomegranate flavors play against a strongly rocky minerality, with hints of toasted wood toward the finish.

title: Feudo Montoni 2020 Timpa Grillo (Sicilia)
description: From one of the top estates on the island, this lovely white doesn't disappoint. It opens with aromas of citrus, Mediterranean brush and spring blossom while the linear, vibrant palate features juicy grapefruit, green melon and crushed botanical herbs. A hint of saline gives it a savory close.

title: Whistler 2018 Corvus Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a small amount of whole-cluster grapes, this red offers dry-farmed intensity and mineral undertones, with notes of stone, crushed rock and earth. Dried herb and tea accent a medium-bodied ripeness of red cherry and raspberry.

title: The Walls 2019 Wonderful Nightmare Stoney Vine Vineyard Tempranillo (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Tempranillo plantings are miniscule in the Rocks District, but the resulting wines are always fascinating. The aromas here are distinctive, with notes of peat, dried tobacco, flower and cherry. Plush, soft fruit flavors follow, showing the high pH feel this area is known for. It hangs on the finish.

title: 30 Degrees 2019 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Earthy aromas of pinched sage, turned soil and mace meet with smashed red plum on the nose of this bottling. The palate is packed with sage, thyme and orange rind flavors that play against the cranberry backbone.

title: Andreola 2020 Dirupo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: White spring blossom, orchard fruit and botanical herb aromas lead the nose. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity and a refined perlage accompany ripe pear, lemon drop candy and green almond.

title: Azienda Agricola Roberto Ceraudo Strongoli 2019 Imyr Chardonnay (Calabria)
description: Rich aromas of toasted almond, grilled lemon, white melon and oyster shell show immense intensity on the nose. It's rounded on the medium-bodied palate yet honed by bright, flowing acidity. Toasted spice tones frame all the citrus and melon flavors, with everything extending on the lingering finish.

title: Cortes de Cima 2018 Trincadeira (Alentejano)
description: One of Alentejo's underappreciated grapes makes a rich, openly fruity wine. Some wood aging has brought out ripeness as well as smoothed the texture. The wine is finely structured and ready to drink.

title: Felline 2018 Anarkos Red (Puglia)
description: This blend of Primitivo, Malvasia Nera and Negroamaro is thick and rich on the palate. Flavors of brandy-soaked black cherry, hay and warm spices are met with a coating of tannins and sharp acidity.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Solo Barrique Malbec (South Coast)
description: Blackberry-jam aromas meet with fennel and anise on the nose of this bottling. That fennel kick is overpowering on the palate, where stewed fruit also arises.

title: La Spinetta 2017 Garretti  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of chopped celery, soy sauce, grilled porcini mushroom and menthol lead the nose. The assertive palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, offering suggestions of prune steeped in spirts, bitter almond and coffee bean set against grainy, extremely drying tannins that leave a clenching, astringent finish.

title: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very minty aromas meet with incense on the nose of this woody bottling. The cedar spice is powerful on the palate as well.

title: Sordo 2017 Monprivato  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of cellar floor and weedy underbrush come to the forefront. On the no-frills, unbalanced palate, grainy, astringent tannins accompany dried cherry, cake spice and bitter almond before a clenching, astringent finish.

title: Succession 2020 Our Evolution White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is a blend of 69% Semillon, 21% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier, with the fruit coming from Famiglia and Antoine Creek vineyards. Aromas of fig and herb lead to medium-bodied, center-focused fruit flavors. The concentration isn't all there at times.

title: Tamber Bey 2020 Lambentz Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white is high-toned and floral, with a wet stonelike quality to the sleek texture. Subdued notes of apple, pear and oak mingle well.

title: Tenuta Carretta 2015 Cannubi Collezione Rag. Franco Miroglio Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of oak, scorched earth and struck match. The assertive palate is extremely lean in terms of fruit richness, offering licorice, hazelnut, menthol and the barest hint of blood orange. Close-grained tannins leave a clenching finish.
designation: Cannubi Collezione Rag. Franco Miroglio Riserva

title: Textura Wines 2020 Pretexto White (Dão)
description: A fragrant, ripe apple- and crisp citrus-flavored wine, this is fruity with a mineral texture. It is bright and ready to drink now.

title: Thierry Delaunay 2020 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: A light and soft wine, this is immediately accessible, with bright fruits and plenty of green flavors. Lit by the citrus and herbal edge, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Tenuta Sant'Anna NV Brut  (Prosecco)
description: Aromas suggesting chamomile and white stone fruit shape the nose. On the simple but well-made palate, crisp acidity and soft bubbles accompany honeydew and yellow apple.

title: Abegoria 2019 Piteira Premium Red (Alentejo)
description: Young, ripe with fine black fruits, this is a wine that will develop fast. Light tannins and juicy fruits are attractively fresh and perfumed. Drink now.

title: Adega Mayor 2019 Caiado White (Alentejano)
description: Now two years old, the attractive wine is just right for drinking. With ripe acidity and melon flavors, the wine is full of fruit that has softened and filled out.

title: Alpha Crucis 2018 Titan Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Reductive and blanketed in what feels like quite a bit of SO2, this wine eventually opens with time in glass to offer notes of ripe cherry and plum, dried herbs and some oak. Full bodied and with elevated acidity, the fruit and tannins feel slightly sour and drying. It's not jammy or overtly oaky, it just feels a bit overworked, winemaking-wise.

title: Alta Cellars 2020 Rosé (Lake Chelan)
description: The aromas of this rosé, which comes from Baresford Rocks Vineyard, offer notes of fresh herb, wilted flower and tin. Broad, thick feeling fruit flavors follow, getting quite bogged down.

title: Amastuola 2019 Organic Negroamaro (Salento)
description: A mix of freshly pressed blackberry and red plum meets orange rind and crushed herbs on the nose. The palate is light in profile, with perky berry and plum flavors framed by mildly gritty tannins.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2019 Calderara Sottana Prephylloxera La Vigna di Don Peppino Rosso  (Etna)
description: Heady aromas of blue flower, menthol, black spice and ripe dark-skinned fruit fill the glass. Made with vines that are over 130 years old, the palate is both plush and elegant, offering juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and blood orange alongside a backbone of velvety tannins. A salty mineral note signals the close.
designation: Calderara Sottana Prephylloxera La Vigna di Don Peppino Rosso

title: Hirsch 2019 The Bohan-Dillon Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This wine is such an outstanding value for outstanding quality, it's crazy. Bright, effusive and lingering in freshly picked berry spice, it offers tension and verve on the palate, showing balanced acidity and lovely, complex accents of lavender and white pepper.

title: Lucia 2019 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A fascinating aroma of lemon rind meets with wet stone, lightly toasted nuts and a hint of coconut on the nose of this bottling. The palate blasts with energetic acidity and clings to a sticky tension, delivering flavors of salt, stone fruit and the lightest brush of macadamia nut toward the finish.

title: Bollinger NV PN VZ16 Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Bollinger is famed for its Pinot Noir vineyards and this single-vineyard Champagne from the Grand Cru village of Verzenay is proof. It is intense, rich with mature fruits and the typical house style of toast mingled with almond. Drink this wine now.

title: Marichal 2018 Reserve Collection Tannat (Canelones)
description: Pinched blackberry aromas include a note of leather, while this fresh-style Tannat is tightly wound, with high acidity. Short pops of tart black cherry, dark plum and blackberry flavors finish clean and short, with a dash of leftover oak.

title: Marie Copinet NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe, soft style of Chardonnay from family vineyards on chalk slopes presents layers of red apple and flashes of lime. It is lightly textured and openly fruity. Drink now.

title: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dark berry and plum meet with caramel on the pleasantly easy nose of this bottling. Tobacco and wood spice show on the palate alongside the dark-berry core.

title: Palladino 2017 Ornato  (Barolo)
description: Scorched earth, camphor, new leather and prune aromas form the nose. The assertive, monolithic palate recalls dried cherry, licorice and the scorching heat of alcohol that throws it off balance. Grainy tannins clench the finish.

title: Paris Valley Road 2018 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly smashed black-cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with touches of tar, black olive and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of tobacco leaf on the front of the palate, which is firm with tannins while running through juicy flavors of blackberry jam and cherry compote.

title: J. Bouchon 2020 Salvaje Blanco Secano Interior País (Maule Valley)
description: This colorless País comes from wild plants that grow like trees and are harvested using ladders. The wine is fermented in amphora, using only natural yeasts. The result is a briny-smelling, saline-driven white with stone-fruit acidity and salty flavors suggesting barely ripe nectarine. Mild oxidation is already apparent on the finish. Drink now.

title: Jasmine Monet 2018 Brut Organic Vineyard Traditional Method Sparkling (Luján de Cuyo)
description: In this wine, baked pastry, apple and pear aromas set up a narrow palate that battles to maintain balance. Flavors of citrus fruits and cider finish with a yeasty note of brioche and sourdough bread.

title: King Palm 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Tart and candied cherry and cranberry aromas meet with hints of minty tarragon on the nose of this bottling. The minty character is fresh and prominent on the sip, which also offers a bit of red fruit.

title: La Gioiosa NV Brut EtAmorosa  (Prosecco Treviso)
description: Aromas of green apple and bitter almond shape the nose. The aromas carry through to the lively palate along with crisp acidity.

title: La Jara NV Brut  (Prosecco)
description: Light aromas of white spring blossoms and orchard fruit shape the nose. On the lively, light-bodied palate, brisk acidity and vivacious bubbles accompany ripe yellow apple skin and bitter almond. It's simple but well-made.

title: Marco Scolaris 2019 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)
description: Aromas recalling underbrush, nut and stone fruit waft out of the glass. The light, linear palate is on the shy side, offering suggestions of green melon and pear before closing on a bitter note.

title: Librandi 2019 Segno  (Cirò Classico)
description: Hints of crushed herbs, clove and black pepper dot the brambly raspberry core in this red. The medium-bodied palate shows good cohesion between the well-mannered tannins and bright, sunny acidity. Tart berry flavors lend a juicy vibe to it all, with hints of earth and herb chiming in.

title: Locatelli 2017 Estate Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Inviting if very rich aromas of caramel and vanilla meet with black-cherry pudding on the nose of this bottling. The palate's extracted character offers black cherries in caramel sauce, with plenty of clove and vanilla spice.

title: Maker 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: A can made by Sutro Wine Co.'s Alice Sutro, this offers dark color and juicy layers of blackberry, baking spice and oak undertones. A lasting hint of coffee bean underscores its rich, brooding character.

title: Mauro Sebaste 2015 Ghe' Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cedar and mocha lead the nose. The dense, rather monolithic palate offers prune, vanilla and cocoa alongside grainy tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink after 2024.

title: McBride Sisters Collection 2020 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This shows classic fruity Marlborough Sauvignon notes: vibrant lime, peach, passion fruit with just a whisper of green bell pepper and a yeast note. The palate is slippery and fruity but dry with a chalk and orange peel finish. A zippy, straightforward weeknight sipper.

title: Opta 2019 Encruzado White (Dão)
description: An attractive, creamy, wood-aged wine. With its richness, spice and yellow and white fruits, the wine is ripe and ready to drink. Suitable for vegans.

title: Fossil Point 2018 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling begins with aromas of raspberry, cranberry, hibiscus, sumac and sandalwood, while the palate picks up herbal and woody flavors alongside a crisp red-plum core.

title: Curatolo Arini 1875 2020 Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Tropical fruit and yellow flower aromas along with a whiff of nut waft out of the glass. Bright and savory, the palate offers pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of saline mineral alongside tangy acidity.

title: Stemmari 2020 Estate Grown Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: This Nero d'Avola opens with aromas of black-skinned berries, Mediterranean scrub and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers fleshy black cherry, white pepper and carob alongside smooth tannins. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.

title: Alessandro di Camporeale 2020 Benedè Catarratto (Sicilia)
description: Spanish broom, mature stone fruit and a whiff of nut form the nose. On the dry palate, tangy acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple, pear and bitter almond before a saline close.

title: Bargetto 2017 La Vita Regan Vineyards Red (Santa Cruz County)
description: Baked cherry, dusty herb and matchstick aromas meet with a tart edge on the nose of this blend of 42% Refosco, 32% Nebbiolo and 26% Dolcetto. The tannic framing is classic, though the flavors are a bit wild, ranging from forest cherry to funky mace.

title: Bovio 2015 De Rieumes Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Initially shy, the nose eventually recalls scorched underbrush, new leather, and balsamic aromas of eucalyptus. On the assertive palate, grippy, close-grained tannins accompany soaked cherry, prune, sage and star anise before a clenching finish. Despite the tannins drink sooner rather than later before the remaining fruit dries out.

title: Krug 2008 Brut  (Champagne)
description: A vintage Champagne from this producer is rare. But 2008 was a great year in Champagne and that shows in this intense, still amazingly young wine. Freshness works with the richness to give concentration, density and the sure-fire possibility of long-term aging. So drink now, but the Champagne will last for many years.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2019 Dagala di Bocca d'Orzo Rosso  (Etna)
description: Made in extremely limited quantities, this gorgeous wine boasts supreme finesse, opening with enticing scents of wild berry, rose, flint and Mediterranean brush. The sole surviving vineyard of a 1981 lava flow that submerged Bocca d'Orzo, one of Etna's most celebrated crus, the palate boasts ethereal elegance and structure, delivering red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and an almost salty mineral finish. Lithe, polished tannins and fresh acidity lend impeccable balance. Drink through 2034.

title: Billecart-Salmon 2007 Cuvée Nicolas François Brut  (Champagne)
description: This beautiful Champagne is amazingly at its peak. Not too mature, not too young, the wine is in fine balance, showing some nervy edge as well as touches of toast. With a small amount of wood vinification, the wine has extra fullness. Drink through 2025.

title: McPrice Myers 2019 Hommage a Stevan Larner Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: An ode to Ballard Canyon pioneer Stevan Larner, this is a brilliant blend of 68% Syrah and 32% Grenache, combining the region's coolish climate ways with McPrice Myers' richer style. Focused, pure and penetrating aromas of boysenberry and moist soil lead into a vicious palate that coats the mouth in unparalleled ways with unwavering yet expertly ripe flavors of berry, violet and pepper.

title: Lété-Vautrain 2013 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: At eight years, this is now a mature Champagne, rich with ripe stone fruit and a soft aftertaste. It is full in the mouth and ready to drink.

title: Meyer-Fonné 2018 Wineck-Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Candied lemon shows on the nose of this wine. Alcohol presides over the palate, adding oomph and weighty texture to lighthearted mandarin, lemon-drop and fresh fennel-inflected flavors. The battle between bright citrus and warm burn continues into a long, complex finish.

title: Photograph 2019 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This is satisfying wine, especially for the price. Aromas of toasted macadamia nuts, dried lemon rinds and orange-blossom extract lead into a softly texture palate of gardenia, guava and plumeria flavors.

title: Rainstorm 2019 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This well-constructed value wine offers light raspberry and strawberry buoyed by gentle acidity. There is just enough of a phenolic edge to the tannins to keep the finish firm.

title: Elephant Seven 2018 Yellow Bird Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a vineyard in Upper Mill Creek and cofermented with 8% Viognier, this offers a mixture of tangerine peel, raspberry, flower and plum aromas on the nose. Lightly styled fruit and barrel flavors follow, with the barrel use lending a creamy texture to it all.

title: North by Northwest 2017 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aromas are forward in notes of herb, Dimetapp cough medicine, smoke and purple gummy candy. Ripe, full-bodied purple fruit flavors follow, with barrel notes interlaced.

title: Schola Sarmenti 2019 Roccamora Negroamaro (Nardò)
description: Rich aromas of toasted vanilla and anise ride over a plummy, dense core in this red. This is pleasantly plush on the palate thanks to smooth tannins, with juicy blackberry and red-plum flavors wrapped in toasted spice accents.

title: Sipwell 2020 Go Getter Red (San Antonio Valley)
description: This canned Dolcetto is a promising show for lightly bodied, sparkling Dolcetto from this warm appellation. A light shade of fuchsia in the glass, it begins with tart pomegranate on the nose and then leads into a fairly grippy palate, where light cranberry and wet stone flavors align.

title: Succession 2019 Oscar Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This 100% varietal is a mix of fruit from Candy, Famiglia and Chouette vineyards. The color is light enough it could pass for Pinot Noir. Aromas of cigar box, dried herbs and cherry lead to dialed back pit fruit flavors. The intensity is quite light, but what's there is pleasing.

title: Succession 2019 Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fruit for this wine comes from Antoine Creek Vineyard by the Lake Chelan appellation. The color is transparent ruby, showing some bricking. The aromas are subdued, exhibiting notes of cigar box, dried herb and flower. The palate is juicy, with tart strawberry flavors. The concentration is light, and one would like to see more distinctly varietal aromas, but it's interesting.

title: Tantara 2017 Lolita Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Tangy aromas of red-plum skins and pomegranate kick off the nose on this blend. The palate is also a tad sour, with red plum as well as plucked thyme, bay leaf and minty herb flavors.

title: Val d'Oca 2020 Rive di San Pietro di Barbozza Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: White spring blossom, orchard fruit and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose. On the palate, lively acidity and a vibrant perlage accompany ripe pear, golden apple and lemon drop candy.
designation: Rive di San Pietro di Barbozza Brut

title: Sandoval Mergenov 2018 Rockets Red Wine Top Secret Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Not only does this bottling deserve respect for honoring veterans (bonus: the winemaker is a vet and these grapes were harvested on Veteran's Day), it's a tasty expression of Grenache as well. Aromas of fresh mulberry, dried fig, cracked pepper and roasted game lead into a smoothly integrated palate where the fruit, spice and wood elements work together in elegant harmony.

title: Paul Vattan 2019 Grande Cuvée  (Sancerre)
description: Although still young, this ripe wine has all the elements for a fine future. Rich citrus fruits, acidity and a tight texture are promising, dense and with packed spice and zest at the end. Drink from 2022.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)
description: The tawny gold color belies the youth of this wine, and sure enough it's moved ahead on the aging curve to where it is already in a prime drinking window. Full-bodied, chewy and tannic, it's a potent wine with an assortment of herb, citrus and tree fruit elements all in a pleasing tangle. Drink through 2030.

title: Redmon 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Tangy and tart in high acidity, this red offers lithe, crisp layers of currant, cranberry and cassis, the fruit from the Immaculate Vineyard. Lengthy, with well-integrated tannin and oak, it has a touch of reduction that adds earthiness and complexity.

title: Decroux 2018 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft aromas of lightly baked red fruits, dried red flowers and a pinch of baking spice show on the nose of this bottling. There's a tight core of red spices and tart red fruits on the palate, with ample acidic kick to the cranberry and raspberry flavors.

title: Folktale 2018 The Mountain Massa Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: This bottling, which includes 17% Malbec and spent 22 months in 83% new French oak, is one of the first offerings from this historic but recently reinvigorated vineyard. Aromas of dried cherry and mulling spices lead into a tense and woody palate, where cigar-box flavors frame thicker dried fruit and mint flavors. The tannins are firm but relenting enough, and will smooth with patience. Drink now through 2038.

title: Chakana 2018 Estate Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blueberry and cassis aromas are jumpy, with an infusion of spice notes including cardamom. This Malbec from an excellent year is popping with tannic grip and lively acidity. Ripe blackberry flavors are accented by leathery notes and warmth, while a solid finish propped up by acidity shows no degradation. Drink through 2024.

title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2020 Branco Cerceal (Beira Atlantico)
description: Made entirely of Cerceal, this wine has a fine, lifted perfume. Allied to the spice from wood aging, it's a complex wine that has salinity, ocean freshness and richer flavors at the end. It is ready to drink.

title: Board Track Racer 2019 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This second label from Mark Ryan Winery is making a name in its own right. Blackberry, black plum, clove, Mandarin orange essence and spice are followed by well-balanced chocolate and cherry flavors.

title: Öömrang 2019 Estate Müller-Thurgau (Puget Sound)
description: The nose smells like a field in spring, with flower and grass along with flecks of mineral and lemon zest. The palate is dry and flavorful, full of citrus notes. The flavors linger on the finish.

title: The Walls 2019 Gaspard Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Fruit for this wine comes from Red Heaven Vineyard. The aromas are locked up and high pitched, with notes of coffee, plum and spice. The flavors are full-bodied. It's a bit clenched at present. Give it some additional time in the bottle or decant.

title: Fontanafredda 2020 Rosato (Langhe)
description: Red berry, violet and crushed botanical herb aromas waft out of the glass. Savory and refreshing, the bright, dry palate features ripe strawberry, tart cherry, white pepper and a hint of fennel seed alongside crisp acidity.

title: Torbreck 2019 Cuvée Juveniles Red (Barossa Valley)
description: This is a classy, harmonious bottling made from Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. It's full of plump plum, black currant, mint, violet, tobacco and iodine flavors. The tannins are herbal, chalky and powerful, and the mouthfeel is silky. Drink now–2028.

title: Clif Family 2018 Gary's Improv Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: The grapes for this 100% varietal wine come predominantly from Beatty Ranch, and many of the vines are more than 100 years old. Thick in brick, blackberry, oak and tannin, it offers a powerfully built and lengthy experience on the palate, laced in baking spice.

title: Donnafugata 2019 Floramundi  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria)
description: Vinous aromas of just pressed grapes mingle with whiffs of blue flower and vineyard dust. The smooth, easygoing palate offers blackberry jam, ripe black cherry and a hint of licorice alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Puccioni 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the producer's own ranch and blended with 14% Petite Sirah, this wine is rustic in varietally welcoming blackberry, cigar box and herb. High-toned acidity gives it a crisp, citrus zing, allowing the otherwise full-bodied and concentrated expression to stay fresh and focused.

title: Sagemoor 2020 Estate White (White Bluffs)
description: Crafted by Ali Mayfield and fermented in concrete and French oak, this wine is a blend of Bacchus and Gamache Sauvignon Blanc (72%) and Dionysus Semillon. The aromas intrigue, with notes of mineral, herb, tropical fruit, lemon pith and pink grapefruit. Full feeling and palate coating flavors follow. It delights and is also a superb value.

title: The Walls 2019 Bellamy Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Blended with 19% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc, this Cabernet Sauvignon exhibits savory herb aromas out front initially, followed by notes of orange zest, flower, tobacco leaf and cherry. Fresh, supple raspberry and cherry flavors follow. It's a very pretty expression of Cabernet, with plenty of substance behind it.

title: Portalupi 2019 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)
description: Handsomely oaked, this complex and layered wine lures with aromas of cocoa, dark chocolate and tamarind, followed by plentiful black-cherry, sour-cherry and blackberry flavors. Fine-grained tannins and a full body carry the richness well.

title: Quintodecimo 2019 Jaune D'Arles  (Greco di Tufo)
description: Aromas of sea breeze, stone fruit and citrus waft out of the glass along with a whiff of bread dough. Full-bodied and polished, the savory palate features creamy pear, ripe apple and lemon drop candy alongside savory mineral notes.

title: Villa Raiano 2019 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Mineral-driven and loaded with tension and finesse, this has enticing aromas of smoke, stone fruit and spring field flowers. Polished and medium-bodied, the dry, savory palate has an understated elegance, featuring ripe yellow pear, hazelnut and the barest hint of honey alongside an almost salty mineral note.

title: Cambria 2018 Julia's Vineyard Signature Collection Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Stewed cherry, toast and sandalwood aromas align on the nose of this bottling. Sour-cherry-compote flavors come through on the palate as do sagebrush and mountain-herb elements.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2018 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasty and lightly buttery aromas of white-peach jam, roasted nuts and coconut flake show on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of opulence on the palate, where clean lines of chalk and white-flesh fruits meet with more butter and almond flavors.

title: Thirty-Seven 2018 Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This wine offers outstanding value, a full-bodied, unctuous expression of the variety that is tart and tangy in rose petal earthiness. Red and black fruit, forest and tannin play well in a complementary manner, the oak held in check.

title: Jeeper NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a tight, crisp Champagne, with bright, youthful acidity. The freshness and citrus fruits are enhanced by the mineral texture. Since this is a young bottling, it will be better keeping for a few months. Drink from 2022.

title: Marie Copinet NV Alexandrine Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A steely textured Champagne, this is fresh, mineral and packed with a good balance of citrus and spice flavors. The wine's vibrant character could soften further, so wait to drink this bottling until 2022.

title: Quivira 2018 Wine Creek Ranch Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is actually labeled Sangiovese-Montepulciano as it contains 70% of the former and 30% of the latter, both estate-grown. Tart and earthy in dusty waves of gravel and bright red fruit, it offers medium-bodied rusticity and complex earthiness.

title: Reeve 2018 Kiser Vineyard Upper Block Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: An attractive aroma of rose petals and celery leaves is followed by just-ripe black cherries, black currants and rhubarb on the palate. Medium body, moderate tannins and fresh acidity balance the wine out beautifully.

title: Robert Biale 2019 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From a beautiful, historic site in the appellation, this red is grippy and earthy, with highlights of cedar and cigar that hit the palate first. It delivers full-bodied berry-pie notes on the midpalate, with dustings of tannin and oak spice.

title: Rocche Costamagna 2017 Rocche dell'Annunziata  (Barolo)
description: Inviting aromas of black-skinned berries, forest floor and leather lead the way. The polished, full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2029.

title: Wolfberger 2017 Hengst Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Pear, mustard blossom and stemmy aromas are fun and lighthearted. This wine is vivacious with acidity and has a rich, creamy texture offering all of the lychee and spice you could want. Grassy dill complements those and adds a lovely savory note to this sweet wine.

title: Chappellet 2020 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From estate-grown fruit on Pritchard Hill, this perennially delicious white impresses yet again, offering unctuous, creamy layers of apricot, peach and sophisticated complexity. Underling minerality adds to the compelling mélange of lasting elegance.

title: Croix 2018 La Cinghiale G-S-M (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an impressive blend of 59% Syrah, 23% Grenache and 18% Mourvèdre, rich and meaty on the palate in waves of blueberry, currant and black pepper. Soft, well-concentrated and integrated, it is layered and lush in feel, with irresistible charm.

title: Round Pond 2020 Jannine Bovet Reserve Home Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Structured, succulent and textured, this impressive white is worthy of its reserve status, brimming in Meyer lemon, wet stone and a touch of lemongrass. It is complex and breezy on the palate, with great length.

title: Emercy 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Baked red-fruit aromas are wrapped in luxurious oak and caramel with a pinch of herb for complexity on the nose of this delicious Cab. There's a firm tension to the palate, where hearty and dark-red fruit flavors find a cohesive pairing with the toasty wood and dark spices.

title: Folktale 2019 The Creator Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: This blend of grapes from across Monterey and even into the Cienega Valley makes for a very complex and satisfying sip. Aromas of raspberry, herb, crumpled red flowers and wet stone lead into a robust yet acid-powered palate that's full of dark-red fruit, loamy earth and minty sage flavors.

title: Michele Chiarlo 2018 Reyna  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of truffle, rose, violet and camphor shape the enticing nose along with a whiff of leather. On the savory, linear palate, bright acidity and polished tannins accompany ripe raspberry, black cherry, tobacco and ground clove. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Pio Cesare 2017 Pio  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of underbrush, ripe berry and tobacco mingle with balsamic notes of camphor. Full-bodied, with depth and weightless elegance, the taut palate features dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and graphite alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2025–2037.

title: Liminal 2019 High Canyon Series WeatherEye Vineyard Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: The second vintage from a new site, this is a wine that immediately impresses, with aromas of huckleberry, marionberry, herbs and flowers, showing dazzling purity. Soft, achingly pure fruit flavors follow. The balance is spot-on. This one is all about sophistication. It's only going to get better with additional time in the bottle. Drink after 2024, with a long life ahead of that.

title: Albino Rocca 2018 Cottà  (Barbaresco)
description: Menthol, pipe tobacco and ripe red berry aromas mingle with whiffs of violet on this radiant red. Linear and full-bodied, the tight, still youthfully austere palate offers strawberry compote, star anise and crushed mint alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2026–2033.

title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2017 Nicasia Vineyard Malbec (Paraje Altamira)
description: Ripe and rich aromas of wild berry, cassis, cured meats and animal hide are smoky and slightly baked. The palate on this single-vineyard Malbec is chewy and deep, even a bit chunky. Sun-baked flavors of blackberry and cassis hint at raisin in front of a chocolaty finish with nicely toasted oak notes. Enjoy through 2027.

title: Derby 2019 Fifteen 10 White (Paso Robles)
description: This is a very clean and fresh blend of 32% Viognier, 26% Marsanne, 20% Grenache Blanc, 18% Roussanne and 4% Picpoul Blanc, offering lime peel and more opulent peach aromas on the nose. The palate sizzles with acidity and flashes with a tense texture, showing baked lemon and white-flower flavors.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2020 Alto Reale Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely from Nero d'Avola, this opens with black-skinned berries, eucalyptus and culinary spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, baking spice and cinnamon alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Abegoria 2018 Granja Amareleja Red (Alentejo)
description: A full-bodied wine, mixing spice and smoky flavors with mature black fruits. It is a fine southern blend of Moreto, Alfrocheiro and Aragonez, well melded into a rich, ripe wine. Drink now.

title: CARM 2020 White (Douro)
description: A tightly wrought, crisp, clean and fresh wine, this has a fine balance between citrus fruits and richer yellow fruits. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2019 Quinta do Minho Special Edition Loureiro (Vinho Verde)
description: A single estate wine, this is finely textured with ripe acidity, white fruits and pink grapefruit flavors. The wine shows complexity and concentration. Drink now.

title: Copia 2020 White (Central Coast)
description: There's a slight tartness to this atypical blend of 45% Chardonnay, 35% Roussanne and 20% Viognier, which shows citrus, apple and ash aromas. The palate is fresh but also slightly sour with lemony citrus flavors.

title: Avennia 2019 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard 10th Vintage Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: This is the winery's 10th vintage from this esteemed vineyard, and it's glorious. The aromas erupt from the glass, with notes of blueberry, huckleberry, iron, earth and bacon fat. The palate is chock-full of layer upon layer of textured blue and black fruit flavors along with plentiful herb accents. The finish sails off into the distance. It's flat-out delicious. Give it some time in the cellar to see it at its best. It will have a long life ahead of it. Best after 2026.

title: Chanin 2019 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The nose of this single-vineyard expression mixes bright Meyer lemon flesh with pithy pear rinds and tight apple-flesh aromas, as a hint of pulverized seashell plays the mineral card. The palate is powered by acidity and a stony texture, offering lots of clean rock and lemon-zest flavors.

title: Clarendon Hills 2016 Kangarilla Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: Reminiscent of Southern Rhône, this deeply hued, dense Grenache is under natural cork. Initial mustiness takes time to blow off and reveal the plump, slightly raisiny berry and plum fruits and floral notes. Savory roasting herbs and spices and river-stone nuances follow. Tannins are powerful and powdery, cinching the juicy, silky fruit and spice. This wine still has life, through 2026 at least. If drinking now, get the decanter ready and serve with roast lamb.

title: Kenzo Estate 2020 Yui Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: A lush, opulent wine made by Heidi Barrett from 54% Malbec, 37% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc, this is an impressively structured and complex mix of cranberry, orange and violet, with underlying flavors of blueberry and plum. Notes of violet and dried herb linger on the finish.

title: Lula 2019 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Seductive, ripe and fruity, this wine overflows with sunny black-cherry, red-cherry and blackberry flavors that verge on sweetness but are nicely balanced by fresh acidity and light tannins. Intriguing hints of mint, cinnamon and clove add to its allure.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2020 Santo Spirito Bianco  (Etna)
description: Mediterranan scrub, wet stone and hazelnut aromas emerge from the glass along with a whiff of white stone fruit. On the linear, savory palate, fresh acidity and saline mineral notes lend tension to mature golden apple, toasted almond and a just a dollop of vanilla. It has an understated elegance and aging potential. Drink through 2030.

title: Roger Barnier 2014 Cuvée Exquise Brut Millésimé  (Champagne)
description: With five years' aging before disgorgement, this Champagne, with its high percentage of Chardonnay, is now at its peak. Keeping the nervy edge of zestiness, it has developed concentration and depth from its edge of toast and spice. Drink now.

title: RR Poet 2019 Allusion Pinebrake Vineyard Red (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: This blend of 65% Merlot and 35% Cabernet Franc is an attention-getter. The aromas announce themselves with notes of nori, coffee, struck flint, chocolate and cherry. The palate is plump and polished, with the fruit front and center. Lightly sandy tannins back it up. Best after 2025.

title: McPrice Myers 2019 Sel de la Terre Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A cohesive nose on this bottling showcases aromas of dark cherry, dark wood, incense and cured meats. The palate is ripe and dense yet remains quite pleasant, offering black-cherry, boysenberry and dark-purple-flower flavors, with a pinch of pepper toward the finish.

title: Schiopetto 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Aromas of ripe white stone fruit, hay and spring blossoms form the nose on this medium-bodied white. On the savory palate, tangy acidity and baking spice accompany ripe pear and Rennet apple before closing on a hint of white almond.

title: Sun Break 2019 Cortell-Rose Vineyard Marie-Paule Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Sourced from an organically farmed vineyard, this shows light volatility in the aromas and flavors. That can brighten the raspberry fruit, although for some tasters it will leave a slightly vinegary impression in the finish. It's showing plenty of juicy fruit at this early stage, and the safe bet is to drink it now and over the next two years.

title: Tenshen 2019 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is quite a gamy and powerful wine, starting with aromas of dried beef, iodine, soy, smoked mulberry and cracked pepper. The leathery palate surrounds smoked black plum and grilled blackberry, with persistent game notes lingering on the finish.

title: Varvaglione 2017 Salice Red (Salice Salentino)
description: Lifted tones of thyme, marjoram and orange-laced potpourri spice meet a rich brambleberry core in this blend of 85% Negroamaro and 15% Malvasia Nera. It's full in texture yet shows balance in spades thanks to soft, pillowy tannins and bright, piercing acidity.

title: Lambert Estate 2018 Silent Partner Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: This powerful but well-balanced Barossa Cabernet shows lucidity and varietal expression, particularly if you prefer your Cab on the herbal side. It leads with notes of black olive, charred-grilled green vegetable and tobacco leaf followed quickly by plump black-currant and plum fruit. Tannins are taut, powdery and nicely integrated with the fruit, which is more visible on the palate. It has a long, herbal finish. Drink now with a decant until 2031.

title: Hardys 2019 Tintara Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Despite the difficult growing season and low yields of 2019, many wines have emerged as classy and characterful. This Cab offers lucid yet dusty aromas of dark berries, beet root, licorice, white pepper, graphite and bushels of herbs. It's a big wine, cinching the berry fruit and savory herbs in textured, finely sculpted tannins, but there's elegance alongside the muscle.

title: Bisol 2020 Jeio Rosé Brut  (Prosecco)
description: Fun and refreshing, this bright, easygoing sparkler offers flavors recalling creamy white peach, red berries and a dollop of pastry cream. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.

title: Four Vines 2020 Naked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Fresh and clean aromas of white-flower blossoms, lime juice and citrus peel show on the nose of this bottling. Broad melon and pome-fruit flavors show on the palate, which is quite salty as well.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2017 Coudel Mor Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: A richly structured wine that has fine layers of black fruit and acidity. It is lightly spicy, perfumed and ready to drink.

title: Aimery NV Grande Cuvée 1531 Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)
description: Made from 55% Chardonnay, 30% Chenin Blanc and 15% Pinot Noir, this entices with aromas of lightly baked apple, toasted brioche and orange oil. The palate is bright and effervescent, with a plush mousse and ample acidity to keep it all balanced and refreshing through the close.

title: Antigal 2017 Aduentus Petit Blend Red (Mendoza)
description: Toasty aromas of creosote and campfire embers blanket secondary notes of blackberry and soy sauce. This blend of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot feels thick, soupy and viscous. Flavors of cassis, chocolate and oak spice finish peppery and jammy, with a raisiny aftertaste.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2018 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Cola and dark-cherry aromas meet with pine needle on the nose of this clonal showcase. The wine lands with a hearty presence on the palate, where tart blackberry and forest herbs play against a tart edge.

title: Left Bend 2018 Gali Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Slightly tart aromas of lemon peel meet with earthy tones of dried hay on the nose of this bottling. The sour lemon aspect arries through the sip, where baked earth and crushed rock flavors add some complexity.

title: Leone de Castris 2018 Maiana Negroamaro (Salice Salentino)
description: Ripe red-plum and cherry aromas meet lifted elements of crushed herbs and savory spices on the nose of this Negroamaro. It's smooth and supple on the palate, yet properly perked up by bright acidity and framed by velvety tannins.

title: Librandi 2019 Efeso Tenuta Rosaneti Montonico Bianco (Calabria)
description: This is a rich, buttery white that blends melon and seared lemon flavors. It's full and viscous on the palate, yet properly balanced by bright acidity. For those who like bold, textural white wines, this one's for you.

title: Masseria del Feudo 2018 Haermosa Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Spanish broom, freshly made bread dough and ripe white stone fruit aromas come to the forefront. On the dry palate, tangy acidity accents lemon zest, saline and white almond notes.

title: Mure 2019 Calcaires Jaunes Riesling (Alsace)
description: This lively wine starts with aromas of ocean spray on rocks. Savory and mineral characteristics come through on the palate, as well as a bright streak of acid and intriguing hint of anise. The acid and salinity make this wine a great pairing for fried foods.

title: Animale 2017 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of dried tobacco, orange peel, smoke and nori, leaning into the savory and seeming more evolved than its age might indicate. Lightly smoky flavors follow.

title: Bella Luna 2019 Rotor Head Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and licorice aromas show on the nose of this blend of Ruby Cabernet and Merlot. It's a bit tart on the palate with rustic, gritty tannins.

title: Bellenda 2018 Sei Uno Metodo Classico Rive di Carpesica Extra Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting spring blossoms, orange zest and walnut with whiffs of medicinal herbs. Reflecting the nose, the rather assertive palate offers citrus, bitter nut, yellow apple skin and hints of adhesive bandage alongside vigorous bubbles and brisk acidity.
designation: Sei Uno Metodo Classico Rive di Carpesica Extra Brut

title: Benvenuto 2020 Orange Non Filtrato Zibibbo (Calabria)
description: A delicate shade of rose gold in the glass, this skin-contact white offers quiet tones of blossom, hay, peach and oolong tea. The texture is the most compelling part, with a gentle tannic grip framing the pleasantly plump palate.

title: Brimoncourt NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: On the soft side, this red-fruit and spice-flavored wine is rounded, with an open texture. It is ready to drink.

title: Cameron Hughes 2018 Field Blend Red (Mendocino County)
description: This vivid, full-bodied wine boasts flavors of iron, cedar, red and black cherries on a texture of light tannins lifted by a bit of cranberry acidity. Plenty of fruit and a light touch with oak seasoning keep it fresh-tasting.

title: Redmon 2018 Redmon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Entirely varietal, this estate wine is thick in tannin and oak, with underlying layers of acidity that contribute freshness. Tart red fruit continues the theme, blending cassis and currant with baking spice and cedar.

title: Silverado 2020 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Blended with 7% Sémillon and stainless-steel fermented, this is a sleek, acid-driven white. It offers a tart layer of grapefruit that builds to a richer core of pear and vanilla candy. Cohesive and complex, it is an enjoyable wine.

title: Marimar 2020 Estate Grown Don Miguel Vineyard Albariño (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned acidity keeps this wine fresh and succulent, with strong fruit flavors of stone fruit, citrus and white flower. A touch of baking spice rides along the fruity midpalate, the wine fermented in stainless steel.

title: Acumen 2018 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This mountain wine is thick and rich in plush layers of tannin, dried herb and currant, with additional notes of sage and cedar. The fruit is a mix of red and blackberry, contrasting well against the baking-spice accents of the oak.

title: Comtes de Dampierre NV Grande Cuvée  (Champagne)
description: The Comtes de Dampierre have 600 years of history. This is the nonvintage cuvée from the producer based in Bouzy on the Montagne de Reims. It well textured, rich and fresh where it should be. Mineral fruits are ripe, with a good touch of maturity. Drink now.

title: Cuvaison 2020 Small Lot Rosé of Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Textured and grippy with moderate weight and well-integrated acidity, this estate-grown wine is deliciously layered in flavors of orange, strawberry and peach.

title: Quinta de S. Sebastião NV Q.S.S. Rare White (Vinho Verde)
description: A spritzy, light and clean wine. Off-dry, it is citrusy, fresh and ready to drink.

title: Raeburn 2020 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is simple and approachable, made in relatively large amounts at a value-minded price. The red fruit is upset by harsh tannin and a thinness to the palate.

title: Santa Rita 2020 120 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Citrusy aromas are slightly floral and mostly fresh. The palate on this SB is grabby and green, as are the flavors, which suggest sweet melon and grass. A flat finish closes things out.

title: TerraNoble 2018 Gran Reserva Carignan (Maule Valley)
description: Earthy red-berry aromas are a bit stalky and mulchy, with little brightness or focus. A punchy mouthfeel is driven by piercing red-fruit acidity, while this Carignan is tart, with rhubarb and currant flavors. A lean finish is dry, rubbery and grabby.

title: Adega Mayor 2019 Caiado Rosé (Alentejano)
description: Softly fruity, the wine is mature. It hints at a slight oxidation that contrasts with the final acidity. Drink now.

title: Don Rodolfo NV Art of the Andes Brut Rosé (Mendoza)
description: In this wine, a rusty orange color and basic aromas of stone fruits, generic citrus and vanilla lead to a soft and foamy palate. Vague flavors of citrus and apple come with touches of nutmeg and cinnamon, while a static finish does nothing to push this forward.

title: Dorcich 2019 Estate Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Punchy aromas of strawberry, water melon and cinnamon make for a fresh style of Malbec in this bottling. It remains lighter bodied on the palate but with a grippy tension that frames the dried red-fruit and leather flavors.

title: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Dark-berry aromas meet with wet earth and smoky maple on the nose of this bottling. There's a charcoal flavor to the palate, where loamy earth, pepper, leather and fennel elements converge with a dark-blackberry-sauce core.

title: Mud House 2019 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: This is an easygoing Pinot with heaps of bright cranberry and cherry fruit backed by more earthy, mushroomy, floral notes. In the mouth, there's an appealing raspy texture to the combo of savory, spicy tannins and silky red fruit. It's medium-bodied and drinking well now or could hold up well over the next few years.

title: Produttori di Manduria 2020 Alice Verdeca (Salento)
description: Ripe aromas of yellow apple, melon and white blossoms mix with a hint of candied banana. It's juicy and gently creamy on the palate, with driven acidity pushing along all the ripe fruit flavors. There's excellent presence and lift to it all.

title: Reustle 2017 Estate Selection Prayer Rock Vineyards Merlot (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a muscular wine, tannic and sturdy. The ripe black fruits are swathed in barrel flavors of toast, coconut and mocha. It's forward and big enough to work with cuts of beef or anything rich and has the oiliness necessary to slice through the tannins.

title: Smashberry 2020 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Pear, apple rind and creamy white-peach aromas kick off the nose of this bottling. It's viscous and a tad sweet on the palate, where ripe melon and cherimoya flavors occupy the midpalate as a lime peel picks up the finish.

title: Stemmari 2018 Cantodoro Riserva Red (Sicilia)
description: Made with 80% Nero d'Avola and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, vanilla and underbrush. On the straightforward palate, smooth tannins accompany prune, tobacco and toasted hazelnut.

title: Zardetto NV Brut Long Charmat  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: This bright, creamy sparkler has delicate scents recalling hawthorn, summer orchard fruit and bitter almond. The vibrant palate offers ripe yellow apple and Bartlett pear framed in lively acidity.

title: Collalto 2020 Brut San Salvatore  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Creamy and fragrant, this offers aromas of honeysuckle, citrus and ripe orchard fruit. On the bright palate, vibrant acidity and a foaming perlage accompany white peach, green melon and Granny Smith apple.

title: Dark Horse 2019 Merlot (California)
description: A flinty character dominates this otherwise smooth and polished wine. Aromas of tobacco and wood char lead to herb-tinged black-cherry and black-currant flavors as light tannins add a bit of texture to the mouthfeel.

title: La Jara NV Frizzante  (Prosecco)
description: Made with organically grown grapes, this fizzy wine has aromas of white and yellow field flowers and almond. The dry, tangy palate offers ripe pear, yellow apple and lemon zest alongside bright acidity.

title: Butternut 2020 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Pungent aromas of sliced peach, ripe plum and melon show on the nose of this bottling. Cantaloupe, ripe peach and apple-blossom flavors show on the sip, where the texture is mostly smooth.

title: Canevel 2020 Setage Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Silky smooth, this pretty sparkler has delicate scents recalling orange blossoms and white orchard fruit. On the foaming palate, lively acidity accompanies white peach, lemon drop candy and a hint of white almond.

title: CARM 2019 Vinha da Urze Red (Douro)
description: Bright and fruity with berry flavors and light tannins, this is an accessible wine. Its touch of spice from wood aging softens the vibrancy of the fruit. Drink now.

title: Casa Donoso 2020 Las Casas de Vaqueria Lago Sur Gran Reserva Carmenere (Maule Valley)
description: A creamy nose with milk-chocolate notes includes mint and spicy plum aromas. This hot-year Carmenère is full but a bit flat in feel, with low acidity and general softness. Peppery plum and berry flavors are minty and slightly green. The wine tastes similarly herbal on a short finish.
designation: Las Casas de Vaqueria Lago Sur Gran Reserva

title: Chassenay d'Arce NV Comtesse de Neples Brut  (Champagne)
description: This soft, creamy Champagne is made mainly from Pinot Noir. The light structure and perfumed acidity are balanced and the wine is ready to drink.

title: Corvidae 2019 Mirth Chardonnay (Washington)
description: The aromas bring notes of flower, green apple and citrus. It's starts out broad, lightens in the middle and finishes strong. It's well-priced and very varietal.
